alert.note: Alert for Inland Jefferson; Inland Taylor; Lafayette; Madison (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Lafayette, northeastern Jefferson, northeastern Taylor, Madison, Cook, Lowndes, east central Thomas, Brooks and southeastern Colquitt Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 305 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Boston to 12 miles northwest of Madison to near Perry. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Perry, Adel, Valdosta, Madison, Lake Park, Quitman, Hahira, Sparks, Boston, Pavo, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Dasher, Morven, Berlin, Barwick, Lee, Cecil and Reed Bingham State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Inland Jefferson; Inland Taylor; Lafayette; Madison
